alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 8:21PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas continues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in excess of an inch over the advisory area. The heavy rainfall threat has ended but water will continue to run off. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Junction, Orchard Mesa, Fruitvale, Redlands and Clifton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
